abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the Energy Community of South
            East Europe and Second Adaptable Program Loan (APL) Project
            for Turkey were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; the
            risk to development outcome was low or negligible; the
            Bank's performance was satisfactory; and the borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: analyze and put in place critical program level
            conditions and design elements for success when designing
            and implementing programmatic operations. Creating a formal
            project identity for regional engagements will enhance
            visibility and accountability within the bank for operations
            involving complex regional dialogue and structures.
            Opportunities for enhanced coordination between electricity
            market actors in Turkey remain and should be exploited. In
            order to maximize the benefits provided by the flexibility
            of the APL instrument, define clear criteria for
            subprojects, ensure sufficient size of individual loan installments.
